definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
that/those/then (in that case)/commonly pr. [nei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing
to shift (funds)/to (legitimately) take funds set aside for one purpose in order to use them for another/to embezzle/to misappropriate
to move/to shift/to move out of the way/to divert (money etc) to a different purpose
to move (sth) aside/to step aside/to move over (when sitting on a bench)/to shift (one's gaze)
to borrow money for a short time
(dialect) to move (after being some time in the same place)/to move (house)
see 閃轉騰挪|闪转腾挪[shan3 zhuan3 teng2 nuo2]
to move nimbly about, dodging and weaving (martial arts)

sentences.english: Do you think maybe you could move it?
Alternating and moving my feet one inch at a time.
sentences.chinese: 兩條腿交替向前挪步，一次挪一英寸。

sentences.english: Even I don't feel like moving my hand which holds the mouse.
sentences.chinese: 甚至握着鼠標的手都懶得挪一下位置。

sentences.english: Move the desk to make it even with the others.
sentences.chinese: 把那張桌子挪一下使他與其他桌子取齊。

sentences.english: The pigface was slightly prickly and she shifted a little.
sentences.chinese: 海濱蘋果讓她微微有一點刺痛的感覺，她挪了挪身子。

sentences.english: The pigface was slightly prickly and she shifted a little.
sentences.chinese: 海濱蘋果讓她微微有一點刺痛的感覺，她挪了挪身子。

sentences.english: The desk is in the way, please move it.
sentences.chinese: 這張書桌擋道了，請把它挪掉吧。

sentences.english: Frozen German casualties were removed from their foxholes and Allied troops moved in.
sentences.chinese: 凍僵的德國傷員被擡出散兵坑，他們的戰友再挪進去。

sentences.english: I think we can squeeze you in.
sentences.chinese: 我想我們可以給你挪個位子。

sentences.english: She turned her head, and moved aside on the step as he approached.
sentences.chinese: 她轉過頭看見了他，於是往一旁挪了挪。

sentences.english: She turned her head, and moved aside on the step as he approached.
sentences.chinese: 她轉過頭看見了他，於是往一旁挪了挪。

sentences.english: The Policeman hesitates, vacillates, then takes another rather uncertain step or two forward.
sentences.chinese: 警察猶豫了一下，滿腹狐疑地又往前挪了一兩步。

sentences.english: Shunt your suitcases,let me go through.
sentences.chinese: 把你的行李箱挪一挪，讓我過去。

sentences.english: Regular meeting from the move on TV a lot of good advertisement come up to the network.
sentences.chinese: 一定會從電視上挪很多硬廣告到網絡上來。

sentences.english: He appropriated public funds for his own private use.
Her friends noticed the change and stood rooted with terror;
sentences.chinese: 她的朋友們注意到了這個變化，卻害怕地挪不了步。

definition: to move (sth) aside/to step aside/to move over (when sitting on a bench)/to shift (one's gaze)
to lean forward/to lean out (of a window, door etc)
to move (i.e. relocate oneself)/to move (sth relatively heavy or bulky)/to shift/to copy indiscriminately
to lift/to raise/(of two or more persons) to carry
to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]
to approach/to get close to/to sneak up on/near to
